citeinfo.title: World Country Memberships of Political Organizations : ESRI Data & Maps 2007

serinfo.issue: 2007 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract: This polygon layer joins the World Country Memberships of Political Organizations attribute table to the ESRI Data & Maps 2007 : World Countries 2007 datalayer, to enable spatial displaying of World Country Memberships of Political Organizations attributes.World Country Memberships of Political Organizations (table) represents the memberships of countries in world political organizations such as the United Nations, the International Monetary Fund (IMF), and the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO).
descript.purpose: World Country Memberships of Political Organizations (table) provides world political organizations memberships by country.

theme.themekey: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations

cntinfo.cntinst: In the United States-Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact Technical Support by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com; ESRI holidays excluded. Outside the United States-Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contactint.cfm. For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by ESRI for Data & Maps 2002: Combined Serbia and Montenegro into Yugoslavia. Updated Fips_cntry attribute for East Timor and Yugoslavia.The following steps were performed by ESRI: Extracted data set from the U.S. Central Intelligence Agency publication, The World Factbook 1992. Added attribute values from ArcWorld 1:3M and the Oxford Atlas of the World. Renamed attribute names. Removed attributes Abbrevname, Region, and Continent. Removed records for Soviet Union, Yugoslavia, and Czechoslovakia. Added new records from The World Factbook 2000 and other Geographic Reference materials. Updated Capital attribute values to match World Cities data set.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated the membership information based on a review of The World Factbook. Renamed Yugoslavia to Serbia & Montenegro and updated the membership information. Changed GA_MEMB_YR field to "2002" for East Timor and Switzerland.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Changed CNTRY_NAME attribute value from 'East Timor' to 'Timor Leste'. Removed the feature for Taiwan.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Verified and updated all country memberships. Removed the Paracel and Spratly island groups.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added the EU attribute with its values provided by the World Factbook. Verified and updated all country memberships. Converted the data set to SDC.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Updated EU status to 'Y' for both Bulgaria and Romania. Added separate records for new countries Serbia and Montenegro. Deleted record for former single country Serbia and Montenegro.

The 'World Country Memberships of Political Organizations' table was originally downloaded from the ESRI Data and Maps 2007 DVD. The table was then joined to the "World Countries 2007" shapefile in ArcGIS 9.2 using the "Join" tool. The joined data was saved as a new shapefile and then exported from ArcCatalog to an ArcSDE 9.1 database using the "Feature Class to Feature Class" export tool.

enttyp.enttypd: The table represents the memberships of countries in world political organizations.

attr.attrdef: The country code (three-letter) for the country from Global Mapping International.
The country code (two-letter) for the country from the International Organization for Standardization.
The country code (three-letter) for the country from the International Organization for Standardization.
The 3166-1-numeric-3 code for the country from the International Organization for Standardization.
The country name.
attr.attrdefs: United States Central Intelligence Agency; ESRI; Oxford Atlas of the World

attr.attrdef: The official country name.
attr.attrdefs: ArcWorld Supplement, Geographic and Global Issues, CIA Factbook

attr.attrdef: The short form of the country name from the International Organization for Standardization.
The short form of the country name from the United Nations Cartographic Section.
The local short form country name. This name is displayed using an English character set. It is blank for countries with no local short form name.
The local long form country name. This name is displayed using an English character set. It is blank for countries with no local long form name.

The United Nations political status of the political entity. This identifies whether the political entity is an independent United Nations member state, territory, occupied territory, dependency, etc.
The 2006 estimated population of the country.
The country area in square kilometers using an equal area projection.
The country area in square miles using an equal area projection.
The number allows the country to be shaded uniquely from its neighbors.
Internal feature number.
